result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daron Charles Evans Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daron Charles Evans Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal appeared by video for Daron Charles Evans Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 11/16/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Daron Charles Evans Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal appeared by video for Daron Charles Evans Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daron Charles Evans in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they are still awaiting discovery materials and an offer from the state. Court orders case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Br 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with P.M.R. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daron Charles Evans in court.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 29 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/1/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 8-1-2022 @1P
